system.biography:
TitleFFF 605-1 Priest Morgath
Birthday28 Nuzyael 687
AppearanceAge 32, height 5’ 6”, medium frame, weight 145 lb, plain appearance, fair complexion, auburn hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size6
ArmorCloth leggings, tunic, and hooded robes. Leather shoes. Typically carries a knife or dagger and his staff
Other EquipmentBlack wooden staff, with no carving or ornamentation; Staff of Draining Doom 4 charges remaining [HM3 Treasure 21]
Valuables18d in silver in a money pouch
Notes

Biography

The son of a Morgathian priest, Silas Marchant grew up in Golotha and followed in his father’s footsteps. He is also a member of the Physicians guild, with the rank of Journeyman, and as such he can be encountered almost anywhere on Hârn. Silas’s true purpose is to find a suitable location for the establishment of a new covert Morgathian temple somewhere in Hârn.

It is a common practice for some young priests to be sent out for the purposes of proselytising and corruption of the masses. Those chosen see this as an honour and validation of their commitment to Morgath. The temple hierarchy see it more as scattering seeds across the land. Most will fail, but a few might take root and grow into something useful.

In all actuality, Silas was somewhat of a disappointment to his family, so when the opportunity came, he was “Honoured” with this assignment. Silas is smart enough to understand the risks, but edging on insane enough that he is sure he will never be caught. His goal is to make a temple to rival any in Golotha. Unfortunately he is lazy and careless, unlikely to succeed or survive long.

The only success he has had so far is locating a cache of books and artefacts left from the Theocracy of Tekhos. Rather than return to Golotha and reap the rewards of bringing such valuable goods to the temple, he has kept them for himself, even though the majority of the material is beyond his current abilities to use.

Adventure Hooks

The Incompetent Physician: The PCs need a physician that does not ask any questions. Silas fits the bill, but his incompetence may make things worse.

The Disappearing Patients: Some of Silas’s patients never leave his care. Sacrificed to Morgath, they provide bodies for his experiments. He is not very careful about disposing of the remains.

Gulmorvin attack: Silas got lucky and perfected one of the unique rituals in the books he found. Unfortunately, things have gotten out of hand and the residents of the local graveyard have been turned to Gulmorvin. They are not under his control.

On the Run: Either due to his incompetence as a physician, or his religious affiliation, Silas is on the run from the local authorities. The PCs may be hired to track him down, or Silas may hire them as protection.

The Fall Guy: An Amorvin has discovered Silas and offered him great power and wealth if Silas will act on the Amorvin’s behalf. Those investigating the Amorvin’s crimes will find Silas instead.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
